unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly among individuals aged 30-45. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, attributed the increase to prolonged screen time and stress, exacerbated by the recent heatwave. The hospital has seen a 25% rise in patients presenting with headaches, migraines, and even a few cases of transient ischemic attacks (TIAs).
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a surge in neurology cases this week, particularly among individuals aged thirty to forty five. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, attributed the increase to prolonged screen time and stress, exacerbated by the recent heatwave. The hospital has seen a twenty five percent rise in patients presenting with headaches, migraines, and even a few cases of transient ischemic attacks (T-I-A-s).

unnormalised: The hospital's neurology dept. is now conducting a study to assess the specific impact of heat stress on neurological conditions in the Indian context. Initial findings suggest a correlation between the extreme temperatures and increased inflammation, potentially affecting brain function. The study is expected to release preliminary data by 15/08/2024.
